definitions.example: The normal course of events seems to be just one damned thing after another.

definitions.definition: A path that something or someone moves along.
The lowest square sail in a fully rigged mast, often named according to the mast.
definitions.example: Main course and mainsail are the same thing in a sailing ship.

definitions.definition: A row or file of objects.
One or more strings on some musical instruments (such as the guitar, lute or vihuela): if multiple, then closely spaced, tuned in unison or octaves and intended to played together.
To run or flow (especially of liquids and more particularly blood).
definitions.example: Blood pumped around the human body courses throughout all its veins and arteries.

definitions.definition: To pursue by tracking or estimating the course taken by one's prey; to follow or chase after.
To cause to chase after or pursue game.
